title: Gehenna
data:
***Version [0.28](/0.28 "0.28")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

[![Gehenna entry.png](/images/c/c1/Gehenna_entry.png)](/File:Gehenna_entry.png) **Gehenna** is the [fire](/Fire "Fire") branch of [Hell](/Hell "Hell"), accessible from [the Vestibule of Hell](/The_Vestibule_of_Hell "The Vestibule of Hell").

## Contents

- [1 Denizens](#Denizens)

  - [1.1 General Hell monsters](#General_Hell_monsters)
  - [1.2 Branch specific](#Branch_specific)
  - [1.3 Lord](#Lord)

- [2 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
  - [2.1 Hell Effects](#Hell_Effects)

- [3 Recommendations](#Recommendations)

- [4 Trivia](#Trivia)

- [5 History](#History)

## Denizens

### General Hell monsters

|                                                                                                   |                                                                                                               |                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                     |

| 2 [![Hellion.png](/images/c/cf/Hellion.png)](/File:Hellion.png) **[Hellion](/Hellion "Hellion")** | 2 [![Tormentor.png](/images/3/3d/Tormentor.png)](/File:Tormentor.png) **[Tormentor](/Tormentor "Tormentor")** | L [![Ancient lich.png](/images/3/34/Ancient_lich.png)](/File:Ancient_lich.png) **[Ancient lich](/Ancient_lich "Ancient lich")** | L [![Dread lich.png](/images/b/bc/Dread_lich.png)](/File:Dread_lich.png) **[Dread lich](/Dread_lich "Dread lich")** |

### Branch specific

| L [![Stoker.png](/images/d/d6/Stoker.png)](/File:Stoker.png) **[Stoker](/Stoker "Stoker")**             | \* [![Creeping inferno.png](/images/6/66/Creeping_inferno.png)](/File:Creeping_inferno.png) **[Creeping inferno](/Creeping_inferno "Creeping inferno")** | Y [![Hellephant.png](/images/6/66/Hellephant.png)](/File:Hellephant.png) **[Hellephant](/Hellephant "Hellephant")**                                           | 1 [![Brimstone Fiend.png](/images/9/93/Brimstone_Fiend.png)](/File:Brimstone_Fiend.png) **[Brimstone Fiend](/Brimstone_Fiend "Brimstone Fiend")** |                                                                                                                                             |

### Lord

|                                                                                                         |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| & [![Asmodeus.png](/images/3/34/Asmodeus.png)](/File:Asmodeus.png) **[Asmodeus](/Asmodeus "Asmodeus")** |

## Useful Info

Gehenna is 7 levels deep and populated by fire-themed monsters. You'll meet [hellions](/Hellion "Hellion"), [balrugs](/Balrug "Balrug"), [brimstone fiends](/Brimstone_fiend "Brimstone fiend") and packs of [hell hogs](/Hell_hog "Hell hog"). Beware of [creeping infernos](/Creeping_inferno "Creeping inferno"), which cast [Fire Storm](/Fire_Storm "Fire Storm") when they die, and the [stokers](/Stoker "Stoker") that create them. [Searing wretches](/Searing_wretch "Searing wretch") will also strip away at your hard-earned fire resistance. All the while a mystical Hellish force will assault you (like all Hell branches), causing multiple nasty effects.

Gehenna's layout consists of cavernous areas dotted with small round rooms and surrounded by lava streams. Like every other hell, floors 1-6 are tiny; consisting of one exit, one staircase down, and about quarter the size of an ordinary floor.

The last level of Gehenna contains the obsidian [rune of Zot](/Rune_of_Zot "Rune of Zot"), guarded by [Asmodeus](/Asmodeus "Asmodeus").

### Hell Effects

In addition to the universal [forces of hell](/Hell#Hell.27s_Mystical_Force "Hell"), Gehenna's smoke disables any [scroll](/Scroll "Scroll") reading while inside it.

## Recommendations

Provided you have enough fire resistance (rF+ at the minimum), as well as a way to kill the fire-resistant monsters you meet, Gehenna's first six floors shouldn't be especially hard (for a hell). [Ice](/Ice_Magic "Ice Magic") or [Earth Magic](/Earth_Magic "Earth Magic") will make your travels much smoother.

Gehenna:7, a fortress with a moat of lava, can be brutal if you manage to wake up too many enemies at once while inside [Asmodeus](/Asmodeus "Asmodeus")' chambers: having several hellions all calling down damnation at you after being tormented by brimstone fiends can mean a quick end even for strong characters. Proceed with caution. Asmodeus himself is a tough customer, a weaker version of [Cerebov](/Cerebov "Cerebov") if you will. [Flying](/Fly "Fly") or use of translocations may be useful to traverse lava ponds quickly.

## Trivia

[Gehenna](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gehenna) is a term derived from a geographical site in Jerusalem known as the Valley of Hinnom. According to parts of the Bible, the site was initially where followers of various Ba'als, including Moloch, sacrificed their children by fire. The valley later became the common wasteyard for all the refuse of Jerusalem. Here the corpses and ashes of animals and people, as well as wastes and garbage were cast and, according to legend, consumed by a constant fire. In time it became deemed to be accursed and an image of the place of destruction in Jewish folklore. Gehenna is cited in the New Testament and in early Christian writing to represent the final place where the wicked will be punished or destroyed after resurrection.

## History

- Prior to [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), Gehenna did not disable [scroll](/Scroll "Scroll") reading. Floors were normal sized, had a weaker set of monsters, and [Hell](/Hell "Hell")'s effects were different.

html:
Gehenna

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.28: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
Gehenna is a realm of lava, flames, and damnation. Those who linger will have fire and brimstone rained down on them.

The acrid smoke renders scrolls unreadable.

Gehenna is seven levels deep and contains the obsidian rune of Zot. It can be accessed via the Vestibule of Hell.

A gateway to Gehenna. You can feel the heat. Gehenna seems to be made out of nothing but flames, lava and hellfire.

Gehenna is the fire branch of Hell, accessible from the Vestibule of Hell.

    • 1.1 General Hell monsters

Denizens

General Hell monsters

2 Hellion 2 Tormentor L Ancient lich L Dread lich

Branch specific

h Hell hog C Fire giant N Salamander tyrant 2 Balrug n Searing wretch
L Stoker * Creeping inferno Y Hellephant 1 Brimstone Fiend

Lord

& Asmodeus

Useful Info

Gehenna is 7 levels deep and populated by fire-themed monsters. You'll meet hellions, balrugs, brimstone fiends and packs of hell hogs. Beware of creeping infernos, which cast Fire Storm when they die, and the stokers that create them. Searing wretches will also strip away at your hard-earned fire resistance. All the while a mystical Hellish force will assault you (like all Hell branches), causing multiple nasty effects.

Gehenna's layout consists of cavernous areas dotted with small round rooms and surrounded by lava streams. Like every other hell, floors 1-6 are tiny; consisting of one exit, one staircase down, and about quarter the size of an ordinary floor.

The last level of Gehenna contains the obsidian rune of Zot, guarded by Asmodeus.

Hell Effects

In addition to the universal forces of hell, Gehenna's smoke disables any scroll reading while inside it.

Recommendations

Provided you have enough fire resistance (rF+ at the minimum), as well as a way to kill the fire-resistant monsters you meet, Gehenna's first six floors shouldn't be especially hard (for a hell). Ice or Earth Magic will make your travels much smoother.

Gehenna:7, a fortress with a moat of lava, can be brutal if you manage to wake up too many enemies at once while inside Asmodeus' chambers: having several hellions all calling down damnation at you after being tormented by brimstone fiends can mean a quick end even for strong characters. Proceed with caution. Asmodeus himself is a tough customer, a weaker version of Cerebov if you will. Flying or use of translocations may be useful to traverse lava ponds quickly.

Trivia

Gehenna is a term derived from a geographical site in Jerusalem known as the Valley of Hinnom. According to parts of the Bible, the site was initially where followers of various Ba'als, including Moloch, sacrificed their children by fire. The valley later became the common wasteyard for all the refuse of Jerusalem. Here the corpses and ashes of animals and people, as well as wastes and garbage were cast and, according to legend, consumed by a constant fire. In time it became deemed to be accursed and an image of the place of destruction in Jewish folklore. Gehenna is cited in the New Testament and in early Christian writing to represent the final place where the wicked will be punished or destroyed after resurrection.

History

  • Prior to 0.28, Gehenna did not disable scroll reading. Floors were normal sized, had a weaker set of monsters, and Hell's effects were different.
